backupTrees.description: This process will import journeys and any required dependencies and can overwrite existing configuration if you choose to do so. As such, before importing any journeys, you must first download a backup of your existing journeys to restore in case of errors or unexpected behaviors during or after import.

addAppModal.enterpriseHelpText: Set up SSO to an application like Google, Salesforce, or Office365
addAppModal.consumerHelpText: Integrate authentication with your web, native, or service app
addAppModal.createCredentials: Create a client ID for your application.

addAppModal.clientSecretWarning: Make sure you copy <small class="text-monospace alert-link">Client Secret</small> as it won't be shown again.

accessTab.title: Access
accessTab.responseTypesHelp: Response types this client will support and use.
accessTab.claimsHelp: List of claim name translations, which will override those specified for the authorization server. Claims are values that are presented to the user to inform them what data is being made available to the Client.
accessTab.loopbackInterfaceRedirectionLabel: Allow wildcard ports in redirect URLs
accessTab.loopbackInterfaceRedirectionHelp: This flag indicates whether wildcards can be used for port numbers in redirect URIs. For example - https://127.0.0.1:{port}/{path} for IPv4 and https://[::1]:{port}/{path} for IPv6.

authenticationTab.title: Authentication
authenticationTab.tokenEndpointAuthMethodHelp: The authentication method with which a client authenticates to the authorization server at the token endpoint. The authentication method applies to OIDC requests with the openid scope.
authenticationTab.clientTypeHelp: Type of OAuth 2.0 client. Confidential clients can keep their password secret, and are typically web apps or other server-based clients. Public clients run the risk of exposing their password to a host or user agent, such as rich browser applications or desktop clients.
authenticationTab.isConsentImpliedHelp: When active, the resource owner will not be asked for consent during authorization flows. The OAuth2 Provider must be configured to allow clients to skip consent.
authenticationTab.mixUpMitigationHelp: Enables OAuth 2.0 mix-up mitigation on the authorization server side. Enable this setting only if this OAuth 2.0 client supports the OAuth 2.0 Mix-Up Mitigation draft, otherwise AM will fail to validate access token requests received from this client.
authenticationTab.defaultAcrValuesHelp: Default requested Authentication Context Class Reference values.
authenticationTab.requestUrisHelp: Array of request_uri values that are pre-registered by the RP for use at the OP.
authenticationTab.subjectTypeHelp: The subject type added to responses for this client.
authenticationTab.defaultMaxAgeEnabledHelp: Whether or not the default max age is enforced.
authenticationTab.mTLSTrustedCertHelp: Self-signed PEM-encoded X.509 certificate for mTLS client certificate authentication.
authenticationTab.mTLSSubjectDNHelp: Expected Subject DN of certificate used for mTLS client certificate authentication. Defaults to CN=client_id. Only applicable when using CA-signed certificates.

clientManagementTab.title: Client Management
clientManagementTab.updateAccessTokenHelp: The access token used to update the client.

consentScreenTab.title: Consent Screen
consentScreenTab.nameHelp: A client name that may be relevant to the resource owner when considering approval.
consentScreenTab.descriptionsHelp: A description of the client or other information that may be relevant to the resource owner when considering approval.
consentScreenTab.policyUriHelp: The URI for the client's privacy policy, for use in user-facing consent pages.

endpointResponseFormatsTab.title: Endpoint Response Formats
endpointResponseFormatsTab.userinfoResponseFormatHelp: The user info endpoint offers different output format. See http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#UserInfoResponse
endpointResponseFormatsTab.tokenIntrospectionResponseFormatHelp: The token introspection endpoint offers different output format. see https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-jwt-introspection-response-03

sessionManagementTab.title: Session Management
sessionManagementTab.clientSessionUriHelp: This is the URI that will be used to check messages sent to the session management endpoints. This URI must match the origin of the message.

signingAndEncryptionTab.title: Signing and Encryption
signingAndEncryptionTab.publicKeyLocationHelp: Select the public key for this client to come from either the jwks_uri, manual jwks or X509 field.
signingAndEncryptionTab.jwksUriHelp: The uri that contains the client's public keys in Json Web Key format.
signingAndEncryptionTab.jwkSetHelp: Raw JSON Web Key value containing the client's public keys.
signingAndEncryptionTab.idTokenPublicEncryptionKeyLabel: Client ID Token Public Encryption Key
signingAndEncryptionTab.idTokenPublicEncryptionKeyHelp: A Base64 encoded public key for encrypting ID Tokens.

clientCredentials.discoveryURIDescription: Use to retrieve the OpenID Provider information for this realm from within the application. If using a custom domain remove the /am/oauth2 and structure the call as follows: https://{yourdomain}/.well-known/openid-configuration.
clientCredentials.clientIDDescription: Use in your app with the ForgeRock SDKs or when calling the REST APIs.

generalSettings.redirectionUrisHelp: Whitelist for sign-in redirect URLs. eg. http://www.example.com/signin
generalSettings.postLogoutRedirectUriHelp: Whitelist for sign-out redirect URLs. eg. http://www.example.com/signout
generalSettings.grantTypesHelp: Authorization Code is required for SPA/Native apps.
generalSettings.scopesHelp: Scopes are strings that are presented to the user for approval and included in tokens so that the protected resource may make decisions about what to give access to.
generalSettings.logoUriHelp: Application logo URI for use in user-facing UIs such as consent pages and application pages.

realm.title: Realm
realm.dnsAliasesDescription: List of fully-qualified DNS aliases for the realm.
realm.useClientBasedSessionsDescription: Client-based sessions provide elastic scalability by storing all session state as a JWT in a cookie stored on the client. It is highly recommended to enable signing and encryption of the JWT in the global session service.
realm.typeToAddDnsAlias: Type and press enter to add a DNS alias
realm.deactivateModalText: If you deactivate this realm users will be prevented from signing in. Are you sure you want to deactivate this realm?
realm.activeRealmMessage:
This is an active realm. All configuration data will be lost if deleted. You can set the realm as inactive to prevent login but retain configuration data.

Are you sure you want to permanently delete this realm? This action cannot be undone.

addModal.content: Enter the fully qualified domain name that you want as your ForgeRock realm’s URL.
addModal.secondStageDescription1:
Before ForgeRock can serve traffic over your domain, you need to add an alias from your custom domain to the ForgeRock subdomain of your ForgeRock realm. You do this by creating or modifying a CNAME record for your custom domain name.

To create a CNAME record:
addModal.secondStageDescription2: Sign in to your Domain Name Registrar.
addModal.secondStageDescription3: Find the option to modify your DNS Records.
addModal.secondStageDescription4: Create a CNAME record with the following values for Host and Data:
addModal.secondStageDescription5: Once you have added the CNAME record, click 'Verify' to continue
addModal.thirdStageDescription1: It may take up to 48 hours for these changes to propagate. Warning notices may appear on your custom URL domain until propagation is finished completely.
addModal.thirdStageDescription1Cloud: We will now start the process of generating your certificate. Once the certificate has been generated you have completed setting up a Custom Domain Name for your ForgeRock realm.
addModal.thirdStageDescription2:
To confirm that ForgeRock is serving traffic over HTTPS (TLS) for your custom domain, visit: {domainLink}

ForgeRock will continue to serve traffic through {trafficLink} and your custom domain. If your changes do not appear within 48 hours, you may need to confirm your DNS settings.
addModal.verifyError: Could not verify the specified custom domain. Make sure the CNAME record matches the expected value.

customDomain.domainDescription1: Use a custom domain to enable a seamless user experience between your domain and ForgeRock. Adding a custom domain to this realm will override any
customDomain.domainDescription2: To complete setup you’ll need access to your Domain Name Registrar so that you can modify Domain Name Server (DNS) records.
customDomain.errorDeletngDomains: There was an error deleting the custom domains
customDomain.errorRetrievingDomains: There was an error retrieving this realm's custom domains
customDomain.errorSavingDomains: There was an error saving the custom domains
customDomain.noDomainMessage: You haven't added a custom domain for this realm yet

cors.corsDescription: Allow requests to ForgeRock-protected resources to be made from trusted domains.
cors.getServiceStatusError: Failed to retrieve CORS Service status
cors.saveServiceStatusError: Unable to update CORS Service status
cors.noCorsConfigText: You haven't added any CORS Configurations

corsConfigModal.chooseTemplate: Choose a template for your new CORS Configuration
corsConfigModal.sdkDescription: Defaults for JS SDK sample apps
corsConfigModal.sdkLink: Learn more about the ForgeRock SDKs and sample apps
corsConfigModal.acceptedOriginsDescription: Accepted origins that will be allowed to make requests to ForgeRock from your application in a cross-origin context. Wildcards are not supported – each value should be an exact match for the origin of the CORS request including the port number. Eg. https://myapp.example.com:443
corsConfigModal.acceptedMethodsDescription: The set of (non-simple) accepted HTTP methods allowed when making CORS requests to ForgeRock. The method names are case-sensitive, ensure they are entered in all uppercase characters.
corsConfigModal.acceptedHeadersDescription: Accepted header names when making requests from the above specified trusted domains. Header names are case-insensitive. By default, the following simple headers are explicitly accepted: Cache-ControlContent-LanguageExpiresLast-ModifiedPragma. If you do not specify values for this element, the presence of any header in the CORS request, other than the simple headers listed above, will cause the request to be rejected.
corsConfigModal.exposedHeadersDescription: Add the response header names that ForgeRock returns. The header names are case-insensitive. User agents can make use of any headers that are listed in this property, as well as the simple response headers, which are as follows: Cache-ControlContent-LanguageExpiresLast-ModifiedPragmaContent-Type. User agents must filter out all other response headers.
corsConfigModal.enableCachingDescription: Enable the browser to cache the pre-flight response.
corsConfigModal.maxAgeDescription: The max age (in seconds) for caching.
corsConfigModal.allowCredentialsDescription: Whether to transmit the Access-Control-Allow-Credentials: true header in the response.

updateCorsServiceModal.configAdded: You've added a CORS configuration but the CORS service is currently deactivated. Do you want to activate the CORS service now?

provider.portDescription: Port used by your SMTP server. Common ports include 25, 465, and 587. Please avoid using port 25 if you can, since many providers have limitations on this port.

listView.subTitle: Manage scripts used for authentication and authorization.

editorModal.chooseType: Choose the type of script to create.

deleteModal.body: Are you sure you want to delete script {resource}?

AUTHENTICATION_TREE_DECISION_NODE.name: Journey Decision Node
AUTHENTICATION_TREE_DECISION_NODE.description: Script to be included in an authentication journey node and executed on the server during authentication.

CONFIG_PROVIDER_NODE.name: Configuration Provider Node
CONFIG_PROVIDER_NODE.description: Default global script for Config Provider.

OAUTH2_ACCESS_TOKEN_MODIFICATION.name: OAuth2 Access Token Modification
OAUTH2_ACCESS_TOKEN_MODIFICATION.description: Script to modify OAuth2 authentication tokens when they are passed from the server to the client.

OIDC_CLAIMS.name: OIDC Claims
OIDC_CLAIMS.description: Script to gather and populate the claims in a request when issuing an ID token or making a request to the userinfo endpoint.

AUTHENTICATION_CLIENT_SIDE.name: Client-side Authentication
AUTHENTICATION_CLIENT_SIDE.description: Script executed on the client during authentication.

AUTHENTICATION_SERVER_SIDE.name: Server-side Authentication
AUTHENTICATION_SERVER_SIDE.description: Script to be included in an authentication module within a chain and executed on the server during authentication.

POLICY_CONDITION.name: Policy Condition
POLICY_CONDITION.description: Script to be used as conditions within authorization policies.

SOCIAL_IDP_PROFILE_TRANSFORMATION.name: Social Identity Provider Profile Transformation
SOCIAL_IDP_PROFILE_TRANSFORMATION.description: Script to adapt the fields received by the provider to align with the fields expected by the platform.

OAUTH2_MAY_ACT.name: OAuth2 May Act
OAUTH2_MAY_ACT.description: Scripts are included in an authentication module within a chain and are executed on the server during authentication.

OAUTH2_VALIDATE_SCOPE.name: OAuth2 Validate Scope
OAUTH2_VALIDATE_SCOPE.description: Script used for validating OAuth2 scopes.

listView.subTitle: Trigger scripts based on system events.

deleteModal.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the "{eventName}" event hook?

endpoints.title: Custom Endpoints

listView.noDataTitle: You haven't added any custom endpoint scripts yet
listView.subTitle: Use custom endpoints to extend functionality.

endpoints.getListDataFail: Unable to retrieve endpoint script data

editorModal.endpointHelp: Specifies the path that the script can be accessed at. An endpoint with the name "example" is addressable over REST at the URL https://{yourdomain}/openidm/endpoint/example or by using a script such as openidm.read('endpoint/example').
editorModal.chooseType: Choose allowed methods to create a customized template to start with in constructing this endpoint.
editorModal.globalsHelpText: The variables passed into this script are namespaced with the "globals" object.
editorModal.curlHelpText: Generate a cURL request to call your endpoint.
editorModal.docsHelpText: Custom endpoint scripts must return a JSON object. The structure of the return object depends on the method in the request.

deleteModal.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete this endpoint script?

esv.title: Environment Secrets & Variables
esv.subTitle: Set secrets and variables that are specific to this environment. These will be substituted into configuration or script placeholders.

list.secretsNoDataTitle: You haven't added any secrets yet
list.variablesNoDataTitle: You haven't added any variables yet
list.secretsNoDataSubtitle: Add secrets for use within your environment.
list.variablesNoDataSubtitle: Add variables for use within your environment.

createModal.variableDescription: Add a variable to create a non-sensitive configuration value that is specific to this environment. Variables are simple key/value pairs.
createModal.secretDescription: Add a secret to create a sensitive configuration value that is specific to this environment. Secrets have multiple secret versions, each containing their own encrypted value. By design, the value of a secret version cannot be read after it has been created.

updateSecretModal.confirmDeleteText: Are you sure you want to delete secret Version {version}?

pendingUpdates.updatesToApply: You have {count} update to apply. | You have {count} updates to apply.
pendingUpdates.updateInProgress: Update in progress. Adding or editing of environment variables is inactive until update has completed, which may take up to 10 minutes.

pendingUpdatesModal.tableStageDescription: The following {count} update is pending application to your environment. | The following {count} updates are pending application to your environment.
pendingUpdatesModal.confirmStageBeforeLink: Are you sure you want to apply
pendingUpdatesModal.updateWarning: Changes may take up to 10 minutes to propagate, during which time you will not be able to make further updates.
